cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi (70 km) W of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the eastern Gulf, forecast to slow and turn north toward the north-central Gulf Coast (MS/AL coast) late Monday and Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi/Alabama border (central Gulf Coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Grand Isle, LA to the AL/FL border (includes Mobile Bay); Storm Surge Watch from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to the AL/FL border including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) possible by Monday night; low but increasing chance (up to 6–7%) of sustained 50-kt (58 mph) winds as the storm nears landfall
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible across Mobile Bay and adjacent coastline if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain with isolated totals to 18 inches possible, producing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents beginning Sunday; isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain-bands
